Key Match Events: Pete Alonso hit a three-run home run in the ninth inning to save the Mets' season and send them to the Division Series.
Pre-Game Insights: Mets manager Carlos Mendoza maintained faith in Alonso and said, 'We’re waiting for that one swing. Hopefully today is the day.'
Post-Match Reflections: Jose Iglesias expressed pride in Alonso, saying, 'I’ve seen walk-offs and stuff, but this is one of my happiest moments. It’s a dream come true.'
Pete Alonso said, 'Words can’t explain. This is unreal.'
Mets owner Steve Cohen said, 'Great players, they come through in the clutch, right? Just an incredible moment for him, for the team.'
Mets manager Carlos Mendoza said, 'Proud of him. It’s a dream come true for him and for all of us.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sections of fans behind New York’s dugout at American Family Field began loudly chanting, 'Pete A-lon-so! Pete A-lon-so!'
